intro: Tricheranthes integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are smooth and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Tricheranthes integrifolia is often found in wetland ecosystems and can serve as an indicator species for certain wetland types.
